column4: My system just crashed, when rebooting it says that my filesystem is corrupt. how can i save the files?
Try booting with a rescue cd
where do i get a rescue cd?
Ubuntu Live CDs can be used as rescue cd.
Knoppix CDs too
okay it is booting, what should i do now?
deceide if you can save your files on the network or on a usb-stick
So you should use the rescue cd to make a backup of your files to a safe location.
I have the important files backed up, I just don't want to format/reinstall ubuntu if that's possible
You can try to manually repair your Ubuntu install form the rescue CD.
how do i do that?
First you have to find out what corrupted your filesystem.
Can you read files from hda1 with the rescue cd?
no
What happened before your filesystem got corrupted?
I was browsing the internet as usual and downloaded a PDF... dunno if that led to the failure though
That should not be a problem.
It might be hardware related.
weird, the pc has been working well for ages. any suggestion how to fix it?
Reinstalling Ubuntu (on ext3) might be the easiest sollution.
You could ask your brother to transfer control over the computer to you.
But that is also somewhat difficult to set-up
